howItWorks.title: How do deductions work in DR?
howItWorks.intro: In the Dominican Republic, gross salary is subject to several mandatory deductions before receiving your net pay:

deductions.name: AFP (Pension Fund)
deductions.desc: Mandatory contribution to your retirement fund. Your employer contributes an additional 7.10%.

deductions.name: SFS (Family Health Insurance)
deductions.desc: Health coverage for you and your dependents. Employer contributes 7.09%.

deductions.name: ISR (Income Tax)
deductions.desc: Progressive tax based on your income level. Exempt up to RD$416,220/year.

howItWorks.note: The TSS contribution ceiling for 2026 is RD$207,091.67 monthly (10 minimum wages from the non-sectorized private sector).

leaves.desc: Avoid labor disputes with transparent benefit calculations. Determine notice, severance, unused vacation, and Christmas salary (royalty) in accordance with the Ministry of Labor.
